intro: Erodium tataricum, commonly known as tatarian eryngo, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features slender stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has small, greenish-white flowers that bloom from May to August, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Erodium tataricum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry meadows, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
